DA4BCI 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Domain Adaptation via Parallel Transport (PT)

    domain_adaptation_pt.Rd

    domain_adaptation_pt aligns the source domain to the target domain on the cone manifold of symmetric positive–definite (SPD) covariance matrices using the parallel-transport operator proposed by Yair et al. (2019). The linear map \(E = (C_T\,C_S^{-1})^{1/2}\) ensures \(E\,C_S\,E^{\mathsf T} = C_T\), thereby preserving Riemannian geometry between domains.

    domain_adaptation_pt(source_data, target_data)

    Arguments

    source_data

    Numeric matrix (n × p) of source observations.

    target_data

    Numeric matrix with the same column dimension (p) from the target domain.

    Value

    A list with:

    weighted_source_data

    Source data transported to the target geometry.

    target_data

    Unmodified target data (for reference).

    transformation_matrix

    The mapping \(M = E^{\mathsf T}\).

    Details

    Procedure:

    1. Center both domains by subtracting their column means.

    2. Estimate covariances \(C_S\) and \(C_T\) using the Ledoit–Wolf shrinkage estimator.

    3. Compute the parallel-transport map \(E = (C_T C_S^{-1})^{1/2}\).

    4. Transform centered source features with \(M = E^{\mathsf T}\) so that the resulting covariance equals \(C_T\).

    5. Add back the target mean to obtain the aligned source data.

    References

    Yair, O., Ben-Chen, M., & Talmon, R. (2019). Parallel transport on the cone manifold of SPD matrices for domain adaptation. IEEE Transactions on Signal Processing, 67(7), 1797–1811.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
set.seed(42)
src <- matrix(rnorm(200), nrow = 20)          # 20 × 10
tgt <- matrix(rnorm(200) + 1, nrow = 20)      # mean-shifted target
pt <- domain_adaptation_pt(src, tgt)
} # }
